content:
• Wednesday, September 14, 2011
  • BZ

    Boise Cascade (NYSE:BZ) announces an additional $75M share buyback, adding to the $155M of...

    Boise Cascade (NYSE:BZ) announces an additional $75M share buyback, adding to the $155M of capital already returned to shareholders through a combination of share repurchases and special dividends over the last year. Shares +2.69% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • KITD

    Cloud software provider KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) drops 6.8% AH after proposing to issue more...

    Cloud software provider KIT Digital (OTC:KITD) drops 6.8% AH after proposing to issue more common stock to shore up its balance sheet and repay debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) jumps in the post-session after the company announces its will...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT) jumps in the post-session after the company announces its will resubmit its New Drug Application to the FDA seeking its approval of Intermezzo. Earlier today the FDA had notified the company that it generally agreed with its new proposals following the drug's rejection in July. Shares +13.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • CLC

    Shares of Clarcor (NYSE:CLC) are down 8.4% AH after the firm misses on EPS and revenue for Q3,...

    Shares of Clarcor (NYSE:CLC) are down 8.4% AH after the firm misses on EPS and revenue for Q3, and guides FY11 EPS to $2.25-$2.40 vs. $2.42 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • COL

    Rockwell Collins (NYSE:COL) reaffirms FY11 guidance and announces a $700M increase to its share...

    Rockwell Collins (NYSE:COL) reaffirms FY11 guidance and announces a $700M increase to its share repurchase program. EPS will be around $4.40 to $4.60, compared to the Street estimates of $4.05, and revenue will be between $4.9B and $5B versus a consensus of $4.84B. Shares +1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • CHRM

    Charm Communications (NASDAQ:CHRM) gains +3.7% today after saying earlier it had approved a $10M...

    Charm Communications (NASDAQ:CHRM) gains +3.7% today after saying earlier it had approved a $10M ADR repurchase program.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • CALD

    Callidus Software (CALD +6.9%) continues to move higher after announcing earlier today that it...

    Callidus Software (CALD +6.9%) continues to move higher after announcing earlier today that it had reached an agreement with Pfizer (PFE +1.2%), which would allow the pharmaceutical giant to extend its use of the company's cloud-based sales platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • STMP

    Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) soars 12% today and is now up 46% in one month, as it looks...

    Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) soars 12% today and is now up 46% in one month, as it looks suspiciously like a momentum stock. The company presented this week at the Think Equity Growth Conference, raising its FY11 EPS guidance to $1.10-$1.30 vs. analyst consensus of $0.95. The broader theme for the company continues to be the USPS' pain is STMP's gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • PTNR

    Partner Communications (PTNR +3.9%) trades higher today following an earlier announcement that...

    Partner Communications (PTNR +3.9%) trades higher today following an earlier announcement that it's appointed Haim Romano as its new CEO starting October 2nd.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +8.6%) shares take off after the struggling carrier announces a partnership with...

    Clearwire (CLWR +8.6%) shares take off after the struggling carrier announces a partnership with China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) for developing hardware supporting TD-LTE 4G technology. TD-LTE offers higher potential download capacity than the FDD-LTE tech supported by VZ and T, and can also be deployed in cheaper spectrum.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • TWI

    Titan International (TWI +6.2%) trades higher after Jefferies initiates coverage with a buy and...

    Titan International (TWI +6.2%) trades higher after Jefferies initiates coverage with a buy and a $30 price target. Jefferies says the company should be able to leverage its dominant position in farm wheels and tires into the construction and mining spaces, and recent acquisitions offer opportunities for additional margin growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • TXT

    Shares of Textron (TXT +5.8%) move higher after the firm lowers its FY11 earnings outlook to an...

    Shares of Textron (TXT +5.8%) move higher after the firm lowers its FY11 earnings outlook to an EPS range of $0.90-$1.00 from $1.00-$1.15, and starts a tender offer for all $599M of its 4.5% convertible senior notes due in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • CVC

    Shares of Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) tack on a 6.8% gain after the firm says it has agreed on a deal...

    Shares of Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) tack on a 6.8% gain after the firm says it has agreed on a deal with Time Warner (TWX +1.1%) to allow subscribers to stream content to devices like iPhones, iPads and laptops. The move is applauded as a strategic way to increase the value of cable channels, and try to shut the door on content players like Netflix (NFLX -0.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +7.3%) pops after saying it received notice from the FDA...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +7.3%) pops after saying it received notice from the FDA generally agreeing with the company's proposals to address concerns over the July rejection of its insomnia treatment Intermezzo.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (SIRI +6.2%) is shooting higher after the company reaffirms its 2011 guidance, and...

    Sirius XM (SIRI +6.2%) is shooting higher after the company reaffirms its 2011 guidance, and guides for 2012 revenue growth of 10%, adjusted EBITDA growth of 20%, and free cash flow growth of 75%, to $700M. The market-pleasing guidance comes a month after Sirius lifted its 2011 free cash flow forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • GSS

    Canadian miner Golden Star (GSS -10.6%) takes a hit this morning after revising its Q3...

    Canadian miner Golden Star (GSS -10.6%) takes a hit this morning after revising its Q3 production guidance due to reduced output at its Bogoso mine. Q3 gold production is now expected to be approximately 39,000 ounces, versus previous guidance of 43,000 ounces. Q4 guidance remains unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • CEDC

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -1.9%) is lower today after Jefferies cut it to...

    Central European Distribution (CEDC -1.9%) is lower today after Jefferies cut it to underperform. Jefferies cites a substantial deterioration in the company's "macro context" after lowering guidance in early August, plus higher material and leverage costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • DAL

    CRT Capital's Michael Derchin moves bullish on the airliner sector, saying strong business...

    CRT Capital's Michael Derchin moves bullish on the airliner sector, saying strong business travel demand creates an "unusual buying opportunity..for significant upside returns." Shares of Delta (DAL +4.6%) and Alaska Air (ALK +5.1%) post strong gains after landing on the analyst's favorite buy rated ideas list.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • CIEN

    Shares of Ciena (CIEN +1.6%) are moving higher on takeover speculation after the company...

    Shares of Ciena (CIEN +1.6%) are moving higher on takeover speculation after the company canceled a sell-side conference.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • SVM

    Embattled Silvercorp (NYSE:SVM) responds to fraud allegations by placing blame on the usual...

    Embattled Silvercorp (NYSE:SVM) responds to fraud allegations by placing blame on the usual suspects (short sellers) as trying to drive the company's share price lower. The firm received a little support earlier when Raymond James jumped in and backed (to a degree) their version of events. Shares are now up 12.5% after tumbling yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • INVA

    Theravance (THRX +4.8%) draws some notice from investors after Sanford Bernstein initiates...

    Theravance (THRX +4.8%) draws some notice from investors after Sanford Bernstein initiates coverage with an Outperform rating on shares. According to a SEC filing, the biopharmaceutical company also saw some insider buying recently.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • CWTR

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +14.7%) ramps higher again today as the company's CEO Dennis Pence...

    Coldwater Creek (CWTR +14.7%) ramps higher again today as the company's CEO Dennis Pence continues to buy shares. According to a filing with the SEC, Mr. Price purchased an additional 481K shares of the woman's apparel retailer over the past two days, after purchasing nearly 686K shares last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -1%) is trading lower after Wells Fargo cut estimates and reduced price targets...

    Caterpillar (CAT -1%) is trading lower after Wells Fargo cut estimates and reduced price targets on concerns over economic growth in the U.S. and Europe. The firm says slower replacement demand will likely negatively affect revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • EE

    El Paso Electric (EE -5.7%) dips after Jefferies cut the stock to underperform following a vote...

    El Paso Electric (EE -5.7%) dips after Jefferies cut the stock to underperform following a vote yesterday by the El Paso city council to review rates amid accusations the company is overcharging. If the issue moves forward, the council could institute temporary rates starting next month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • FCX

    Thousands of workers at Freeport-McMoRan's (FCX -1.9%) massive Grasberg mine in Indonesia will...

    Thousands of workers at Freeport-McMoRan's (FCX -1.9%) massive Grasberg mine in Indonesia will begin striking Thursday, as negotiations for higher pay break down. This will be the mine's second strike in three months, and follows recent strikes at the company's other mines in Peru and Chile.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial Services (HIG +2.5%) is up this morning after Credit Suisse raised it to...

    Hartford Financial Services (HIG +2.5%) is up this morning after Credit Suisse raised it to outperform on valuation, citing limited exposure to interest rate pressures or accounting changes from the implementation of 09-G.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • ASNA

    Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) gains 8.5% after a SEC filing lays out the retail apparel...

    Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) gains 8.5% after a SEC filing lays out the retail apparel company's new lines and margin strategies, as well as a plan to migrate from mall centers to "lifestyle centers."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • GLCH

    Gleacher & Co. (GLCH +16%) pops after announcing a 10M share stock buyback through a...

    Gleacher & Co. (GLCH +16%) pops after announcing a 10M share stock buyback through a modified "dutch auction" self-tender offer, which allows shareholders to indicate how many shares and at what price they wish to tender their stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • SPGI

    Following McGraw-Hill's (MHP +1.5%) announcement earlier this week it will split into two,...

    Following McGraw-Hill's (MHP +1.5%) announcement earlier this week it will split into two, shares of firms specializing in online education are bucking a summer-long downward trend and posting some gains today. Education Management (EDMC +13.1%) is leading the pack on M&A chatter with CECO +2%, COCO +3%, DV +1.4% and APOL +1.6% all trailing along.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • SEED

    Origin Agritech (SEED -22%) shares get hit after the crop-seed company misses on its FQ3, cuts...

    Origin Agritech (SEED -22%) shares get hit after the crop-seed company misses on its FQ3, cuts its FY11 forecast and says its CEO has resigned.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM

  • More on the Austrian "rejection" of changes to the EFSF: Austrian finmin Fekter hits the wires,...

    More on the Austrian "rejection" of changes to the EFSF: Austrian finmin Fekter hits the wires, saying the parliamentary committee action today only means a full vote will be delayed, not that the measure has been defeated. European shares bounce right back!
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 5 Comments
  • PLCM

    Shares of Poylcom (PLCM +1.8%) move higher after the firm announces a strategic alliance with...

    Shares of Poylcom (PLCM +1.8%) move higher after the firm announces a strategic alliance with Jive Software to integrate HD video into Jive's social business platform - including chats, video calls and group meetings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM

  • European shares are dropping sharply - back to near flat following big early gains - after an...

    European shares are dropping sharply - back to near flat following big early gains - after an Austrian Parliamentary committee fails to approve an upgrade of the European rescue fund. The euro gives up its gains vs. the dollar, now buying $1.3643, and even threatens the SNB's line in the sand by trading down to CHF 1.2025.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • RRGB

    Piper Jaffray lowers its price target on Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (RRGB -3.1%) by $4 to $28,...

    Piper Jaffray lowers its price target on Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (RRGB -3.1%) by $4 to $28, citing a "high degree of operating leverage in a volatile market." Shares have fallen off 22% over the last month, a steeper decline than peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (MSFT -0.8%) gets a boost when Hilliard Lyons analyst Stephen Turner initiates...

    Microsoft (MSFT -0.8%) gets a boost when Hilliard Lyons analyst Stephen Turner initiates coverage with a Long Term Buy rating and a PT of $29.50 on the strength of product innovation and revenue backlog. Add Turner to the list of pundits who think MSFT will increase its dividend payout, as he says the company is "shareholder friendly" and will reward investors due to a record level of free cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • VRML

    Shares of Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML) jump 22% after the company announces it was awarded a new...

    Shares of Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML) jump 22% after the company announces it was awarded a new patent from the USPTO for a lung cancer treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • AEGN

    Shares of Insituform Technologies (INSU -7.3%) sink after Oppenheimer downgrades the firm to...

    Shares of Insituform Technologies (INSU -7.3%) sink after Oppenheimer downgrades the firm to Underperform from a Perform rating, as poor weather and flooding hurts the piping and sewer business in the near term. Estimates on earnings were slashed to $1.00, well-below the company's guidance of $1.30-$1.40 and consensus estimate of $1.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Analysts aren't thrilled with Dell's (DELL-OLD +1.8%) $5B stock buyback. Ticonderoga considers...

    Analysts aren't thrilled with Dell's (DELL-OLD +1.8%) $5B stock buyback. Ticonderoga considers the move an opportunity for investors to dump the stock, Barclays sees Dell using the buybacks as a major lever to manage earnings "as revenues remain challenged," and Goldman Sachs reiterates its Sell rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • JASO

    Jefferies' Jesse Pichel is downgrading JA Solar (JASO -4.1%) and Suntech (STP -8.1%) to...

    Jefferies' Jesse Pichel is downgrading JA Solar (JASO -4.1%) and Suntech (STP -8.1%) to Underperform, and Trina Solar (TSL -2.4%) to Hold, believing a soft euro hurts the companies, and that falling module prices aren't lifting demand. Pichel also thinks solar pricing has deteriorated to the point where some companies may be selling products at cost.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 6 Comments
  • SVM

    Raymond James is defending Silvercorp (NYSE:SVM) following a fraud investigation from Canadian...

    Raymond James is defending Silvercorp (NYSE:SVM) following a fraud investigation from Canadian regulators, and a negative report from Alfred Little. The firm thinks a Chinese mine brought up in Alfred Little's report is a quality asset, and believes the recent decline in Silvercorp shares presents a buying opportunity. SVM +4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • CAG

    Premarket gainers: JAKK +26%. AEZS +6%. BP +4%. GLUU +4%. SD +4%. SVM +4%. LYG +4%. NVDA +3%....

    Premarket gainers: JAKK +26%. AEZS +6%. BP +4%. GLUU +4%. SD +4%. SVM +4%. LYG +4%. NVDA +3%. INFY +3%.
    Losers: RAH -10%. SOA -7%. GSS -5%. SPIL -3%. DTG -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SOA

    Solutia (NYSE:SOA) lowers its guidance for FY11 EPS to $1.95-$2.05, from a previous range of...

    Solutia (NYSE:SOA) lowers its guidance for FY11 EPS to $1.95-$2.05, from a previous range of $2.10-$2.25. The company says slower-than-expected demand for its products and raw material pricing pressure are behind the update. Shares are down 7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • STM

    Shares of STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) are up 7% premarket, as the tech concern gains with...

    Shares of STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) are up 7% premarket, as the tech concern gains with other downtrodden European chipmakers. The company demonstrated its Windows 8 sensors at the BUILDconference this week and is working closely with Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) on development.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • MGM

    A day after Brean Murray upgraded MGM, Jefferies is reiterating a Buy and $19 PT, following a...

    A day after Brean Murray upgraded MGM, Jefferies is reiterating a Buy and $19 PT, following a meeting with management. Jeffries believes fundamentals at MGM's Las Vegas and Macau properties are improving in spite of macro troubles, and thinks concerns about sales from major shareholders are overdone. MGM +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • BP

    BP shares surge in the wake of a WSJ article that suggests blame for last year's Gulf of Mexico...

    BP shares surge in the wake of a WSJ article that suggests blame for last year's Gulf of Mexico spill could be apportioned more widely than initially thought. Any indication that BP wouldn’t be held solely responsible for the accident reduces the chances of it being found grossly negligent. BP +4.1%, RIG +0.8%, HAL +0.9% premarket. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • JAKK

    Shares of Jakks Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) are up 26% premarket following an earlier announcement by...

    Shares of Jakks Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) are up 26% premarket following an earlier announcement by Oaktree Capital that it's bidding for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) joins a growing list of chipmakers cutting Q3 guidance: the...

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) joins a growing list of chipmakers cutting Q3 guidance: the company now expects revenue for the quarter to be flat to down 4% Q/Q, compared with prior guidance of flat to up 5%. Lattice blames weakness in the communications market as the main culprit. Shares are down 2% premarket. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM

  • European shares move to new highs on the day as investors take advantage of weeks of staggering...

    European shares move to new highs on the day as investors take advantage of weeks of staggering declines to buy for the 2nd straight day. Stoxx 50 +2.2%, Germany +2.6%, Italy +2.4%. The euro reverses an overnight decline to turn +0.3% to $1.3721.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM

  • Though the news was not unexpected, stocks tumble in the wake of the Moody's downgrade of French...

    Though the news was not unexpected, stocks tumble in the wake of the Moody's downgrade of French banks. Hong Kong -1.7%, Japan -1.3%, Australia -1.7%. Index futures: France -2.3%, Germany -2%, S&P 500 -1.3%. The euro -0.6% to $1.3592.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 AM | 3 Comments
